Description: Rim sherd of Chian Wild Goat Style pottery chalice, from area above handle; white slip; interior: reserved band at rim, glazed streaky black below; traces of two bands in added red; exterior: at rim, maeander band running left between dot and billet pattern bands; below, on left, vertical dividing bands consisting of vertical dot and billet, and hook maeanders, and on the right maeander squares.
Curator's comments: Lemos describes this sherd as being in the style of the Würzburg chalices, as the sherds from this group display patterns on the different parts of the vessel which are similar to those depicted on the Würzburg chalices (Lemos 1991, 72).
Bibliographic references: Lemos 1991 / Archaic Pottery of Chios. The Decorated Styles (p. 43 note 96, p. 72, p. 236, no. 158, pl. 15)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.0149) (phase 2)
